content:
DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of DataGridViewColumn objects that are selected in a DataGridView.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.ListBindable(false)]
public class DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection : System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection, System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • MarshalByRefObject
  • System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection
  • DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection

Inherited Members

,

Remarks

The order of columns in the collection is not guaranteed to match the order in which they were selected.

The DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection does not perform efficiently when working with large numbers of columns. Typically, DataGridView controls will not contain enough columns for this to be an issue, but if you are working with large numbers of columns, you can use the AreAllCellsSelected to determine if the entire grid is selected, or you can use the GetColumnCount to determine the number of selected columns (or the number of columns in a specified state). For more information, see Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control.

Properties

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets the column at the specified index.

    public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn this[int index] { get; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the DataGridViewColumn to get from the DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection.

    Property Value

    • DataGridViewColumn

      The DataGridViewColumn at the specified index.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than 0.

      -or-

      index is equal to or greater than the number of columns in the collection.

  • List

    Gets the list of elements contained in the BaseCollection instance.

    protected override System.Collections.ArrayList List { get; }

    Property Value

    • ArrayList

      An ArrayList containing the elements of the collection. This property returns null unless overridden in a derived class.

Methods

  • Clear()

    Clears the collection.

    public void Clear ();

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      Always thrown.

    Remarks

    This method is not relevant for this class. You cannot change the DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection class directly. To clear the DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection, use the ClearSelection method.

  • Contains(DataGridViewColumn)

    Determines whether the specified column is contained in the collection.

    public bool Contains (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn dataGridViewColumn);

    Parameters

    • dataGridViewColumn
      DataGridViewColumn

      A DataGridViewColumn to locate in the DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the dataGridViewColumn parameter is in the collection; otherwise, false.

  • CopyTo(DataGridViewColumn[],Int32)

    Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.

    public void CopyTo (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn[] array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      DataGridViewColumn[]

      The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      array is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

    • ArgumentException

      array is multidimensional.

      -or-

      The number of elements in the DataGridViewCellCollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.

    • InvalidCastException

      The DataGridViewColumnCollection cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.

  • Insert(Int32,DataGridViewColumn)

    Inserts a column into the collection at the specified position.

    public void Insert (int index, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn dataGridViewColumn);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index at which the column should be inserted.

    • dataGridViewColumn
      DataGridViewColumn

      The DataGridViewColumn to insert into the DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      Always thrown.

    Remarks

    This method is not relevant for this class. You cannot change the DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection class directly. To insert a column into the DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection, use the Selected property.

    • ArgumentException

    • InvalidCastException
